comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
A bitter day in Boston: if you forgot to wear gloves on a day of bitter cold, stuff your hands in your pockets instead.

Another Bain/LOC photo from the fire scene:

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4627030274/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The Arcadia lodging house in Boston was a flophouse for transient and indigent single men, who were packed into dormitory rooms. The fire on December 3, 1913, took 28 lives and injured 20 more. A quick response and efficient work by the Boston Fire Department were credited with preventing an even worse disaster.
